answers.author: Kebra Simpson
answers.text:
In the state of South Carolina we have found a very effective way of measuring the impact of Tuition Assistance, we have found that if we place regulations on how the money is dispersed then we have a better chance of it working better for the student. We measure eligibility and the duration of the award. We get many of those records from the Financial Aid offices at the school. Students also have to maintain a certain academic standard in order to keep receiving the aid. Below I have pasted the address to a file that explains this more in detail. 
http://www.che.sc.gov/Commission%20Calendar&Materials/Sept2010MtgMaterials/Agenda_Item_803E.pdf

author: Wydale Holmes
text: As part of continuous improvement, our organizational development office is seeking performance measurements about the effectiveness of tuition assistance programs.  How does your organization measure the impact of its tuition assistance program?
title: Tuition Assistance Programs - Performance Measurement
